The date when Prince Andrew claimed to have broken off his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein during a walk in Central Park, a claim later contradicted by emails from February 2011.

keyTakeAways: Virginia Giuffre, a survivor of Jeffrey Epstein’s sex-trafficking network, wrote in her posthumous memoir that she was raped by a man described as a 'well-known Prime Minister' in the U.S. version and a 'former minister' in the U.K. version.

The memoir alleges that Giuffre was violently raped by a high-ranking political figure, with descriptions of choking, beating, and psychological terror, and that the abuser laughed while inflicting harm.

Prince Andrew, the brother of King Charles, is accused of having sexually assaulted Giuffre as a teenager, with claims that Epstein trafficked her to him and that Andrew engaged in three such encounters.

The memoir alleges that Prince Andrew’s team attempted to hire online trolls to harass Giuffre during her civil lawsuit, and that he paid millions to settle the case in 2022 without a meaningful apology.

Newly discovered emails from February 2011 contradict Prince Andrew’s public claim of ending contact with Epstein in 2010, showing he wrote to Epstein that they would 'keep in close touch and play some more soon.'
The publication of Giuffre’s memoir intensifies an ongoing transatlantic scandal linking powerful political figures to Epstein’s trafficking ring and deepens the public scrutiny of Prince Andrew.
The memoir raises serious questions about the accountability of powerful individuals, especially within royal families, and the broader culture of impunity surrounding abuse of power and minors.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Virginia Giuffre, a survivor of Jeffrey Epstein’s sex-trafficking network, published a posthumous memoir titled 'Nobody’s Girl' alleging that she was raped by a high-ranking political figure described as a 'well-known Prime Minister' in the U.S. version and a 'former minister' in the U.K. version. The memoir details her experiences of physical and psychological abuse, including choking and being forced into sexual acts at age 17. It also alleges that Prince Andrew, the brother of King Charles III, was involved in these abuses, that his team attempted to hire online trolls to harass her during legal proceedings, and that he paid millions to settle the civil case in 2022. Contradictory emails show that Andrew maintained contact with Epstein after claiming to have severed ties. These revelations intensify a transatlantic scandal implicating powerful figures in the abuse of minors and deepen public scrutiny of Prince Andrew, who has already stepped down from royal titles but remains under intense criticism.
title: Virginia Giuffre raped by ‘well-known Prime Minister,’ US version of posthumous memoir claims
